message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the given drug options, indinavir is associated with urolithiasis as a potential adverse effect. Lamivudine and zidovudine are nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors, which can cause hematologic toxicity, while indinavir is a protease inhibitor that can cause hyperbilirubinemia and nephrolithiasis. Pancreatitis can be a possible adverse effect of didanosine or stavudine. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is seen in Addison's disease or in patients taking photosensitive drugs.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the listed medications, indinavir is associated with the adverse effect of urolithiasis. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is an adverse effect of hydroxychloroquine. Hepatotoxicity is an adverse effect of many antiretroviral medications, but the combination of lamivudine, zidovudine, and indinavir is not specifically associated with hepatotoxicity. Pancreatitis is an adverse effect of didanosine and stavudine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The antiretroviral therapy (lamivudine, zidovudine, and indinavir) is most likely to cause urolithiasis (kidney stones) as an adverse effect. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is an adverse effect of hydroxychloroquine, not the given drugs. Hepatotoxicity and pancreatitis are other possible adverse effects, but urolithiasis is the most likely among the given options.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The medication regimen prescribed is known to cause urolithiasis as a common adverse effect. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is a possible adverse effect of zidovudine. Hepatotoxicity is a possible adverse effect of indinavir. Pancreatitis is a possible adverse effect of both lamivudine and indinavir.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only indinavir is associated with the adverse effect of urolithiasis (kidney stone formation). Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is associated with zidovudine, hepatotoxicity is associated with both lamivudine and indinavir, and pancreatitis is associated with lamivudine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only indinavir is known to cause urolithiasis as a frequent adverse effect. Lamivudine and zidovudine are nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors and are not associated with urolithiasis. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is a side effect of hydroxychloroquine and Hepatotoxicity is a side effect of efavirenz. Pancreatitis can occur as a rare adverse effect of didanosine, another nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, urolithiasis is a common adverse effect of indinavir therapy, while hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is associated with zidovudine therapy. Hepatotoxicity and pancreatitis are also possible adverse effects, but they are not specifically associated with this drug combination.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only indinavir can cause urolithiasis as it causes kidney stones. Lamivudine and zidovudine can cause hematologic toxicity, while hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is a side effect of hydroxyurea. Hepatotoxicity is a possible side effect of all three medications. However, indinavir is more commonly associated with urolithiasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only indinavir can cause urolithiasis, which is the formation of urinary stones. Lamivudine and zidovudine are nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors, and do not typically cause urolithiasis. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles may occur with hydroxyurea, and hepatotoxicity and pancreatitis are potential adverse effects of various antiretroviral drugs, but are less associated with indinavir.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only indinavir is known to cause urolithiasis. Lamivudine and zidovudine are not known to cause any of the listed adverse effects. Hepatotoxicity and pancreatitis are potential adverse effects of multiple antiretroviral drugs, but are not specifically associated with indinavir. Hyperpigmentation of palms and soles is not a known adverse effect of any of the listed medications.
